alert.note: Alert for Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 9:52AM CDT until March 27 at 3:18AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Dent, Shannon and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Douglas and Wright. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 951 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salem, Mountain Grove, Ava, Houston, Licking, Cabool, Mansfield, Norwood, Hartville, Summersville, Bunker, Raymondville, Dawson, Huggins, Simmons, Solo, Elk Creek, Bucyrus, Yukon, Success, Bendavis, Prescott, Clear Springs, Eunice, Hazelton, Graff, Arroll, Hartshorn, Manes, Montauk, Pine Crest, Vanzant, Drury, Akers, Darien, Jadwin, Gentryville, Brushyknob, Odin and Round Spring. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
